newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: Irish April consumer prices rise 0.1 pct m/m - CSO.
newsitem.headline: Irish April consumer prices rise 0.1 pct m/m - CSO.

text.p: Irish consumer prices, as measured by the consumer price index, showed a month-on-month rise of 0.1 percent in April, the Central Statistics Office said on Thursday.
Economists' forecasts for April ranged from a rise of 0.1 to 0.3 percent after a 0.1 percent rise in March.
A comparable monthly estimate for April 1996 is not available as Ireland's CSO only began publishing monthly data in January 1997.
The CPI for 11 months to May 1996 was +1.4 percent and was +0.3 percent for the five months from November 1996, the CSO said.
The European Union harmonised index of consumer prices (HICP), which is used for intra-EU comparisons, was +0.1 percent month-on-month and was +1.3 percent for the 11 months from May last year.
